result.execSummary:
All charges against Benjamin Curtis Dornseif in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin Curtis Dornseif is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Curtis Dornseif

11:18 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Benjamin Curtis Dornseif. Defendant Benjamin Curtis Dornseif in court, in custody. INCLUDES 21CF824, 22CF17 and 22CF353. Atty. Satorius recites agreement. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 2 - False Imprisonment, Ct 3 - Strangulation and Suffocation WITH modifier and Ct 5 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier in 21CF824. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 - False Imprisonment, Ct 3 - Strangulation and Suffocation WITH modifier and Ct 5 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier in 21CF824. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 1 and 4 in 21CF824 and cases 22CF17 and 22CF353 in their entirety. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 

Court orders: 
21CF824
Ct 2 - False Imprisonment
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety, sobriety may be verified by Agent
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete Domestic Violence assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- No contact with J. E. H.
- Restitution $1,103.50; payable through DOC
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

Ct 3 - Strangulation and Suffocation WITH modifier
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety, sobriety may be verified by Agent
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete Domestic Violence assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- No contact with J. E. H.
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through DOC
- Domestic Violence Surcharge $100; payable through DOC

Ct 5 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier
90 days jail - 63 days jail credit
- Court Costs $243; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through DOC

Defendant to report to probation immediately upon release.
63 days credit in the event probation is revoked.

re: status of Def. Filed by A.H. km        to ty

AMENDED

INCLUDES 21CF824 and 22CF17
- $500 on file in 21CF824

Defendant may retrieve belongings from residence in presence of law enforcement only.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.E.H. or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center. I further understand that I am required to be equipped with a GPS monitor with restricted zone around victim's residence. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jon Elton Stanek   DF:  Benjamin Curtis Dornseif appeared. Case called at 9:18 a.m. Court notes both files are scheduled for pre trial conference. Court notes preliminary hearing is needed on 22CF17. Atty Stanek states it will be a waiver. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial on 22CF17. Atty Stanek would like to continue to arraignment. ADA Becker will file information to mirror complaint. Atty Stanek enters a NG plea. Court will expand deadline for substitution request by 10 days. Atty Stanek received an updated offer yesterday. Requesting another status. Court schedules. Atty Stanek addresses issue with DE's mother and removal of bracelet. ADA Becker is not aware of any issue with testing device. Did receive notice from JSC they are receiving harrassing phone calls from DE's mother and requesting to have her removed from the bond. Court will not modify bond at this time. Atty Stanek will follow up with JSC. Court would be willing to recall case today if needed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
